course.subject: COMP
course.name: Academic and Professional Development
course.description: This course is for academic and professional development of students in the programs offered by the Department of Computer Science and Engineering. Activities may include seminars, workshops, advising and sharing sessions, interaction with faculty and teaching staff, and discussion with student peers or alumni. Graded P/PP/F.

reviews.author: rubbishandteam
reviews.title: A must-take course for CSE student
reviews.comment_content:
Contents in this course includes:
- meeting with faculty academic advisor
- attend the Department UG Orientation
- 1st term of CSE (eg Year 2 Fall for DSE): attend 1 seminar
- All in-between terms: attend 2 seminars each term for COMP students OR 1 seminar for COSC students
- Last term in CSE: No seminar required
- Fill in a graduation survey
- Might be invited to an optional casual gathering

Details: http://www.cse.ust.hk/ug/comp4900
reviews.comment_teaching: Just some topics related to CSE, sometimes is interesting while sometimes is...you know what I mean.
reviews.comment_grading:
This subject only have 3 grades: P/PP/F (Pass/Permitted to Proceed/Fail)
You must not fail this subject in order to graduate.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not really heavy, just around 2 seminars for each semester. After the seminar, you will need to submit a reflection report with at least 200 words within 1 week after the seminar in Canvas.
Link for reflection template: http://www.cse.ust.hk/ug/comp4900/COMP4900ReflectionForm.docx
Link for reflection Sample:
http://www.cse.ust.hk/ug/comp4900/COMP4900ReflectionSamples.pdf

Seminars are usually scheduled on Wed 6pm-7pm. Some occasional seminars will also count for COMP4900.
Arrive to the seminar venue before 6:10pm and take attendance with student card.

Check your attendance in Canvas (grades).

reviews.author: 新一7代
reviews.comment_content:
Contents in this course includes:
- meeting with faculty academic advisor
- attend the Department UG Orientation
- 1st term of CSE (eg Year 2 Fall for DSE): attend 1 seminar
- All in-between terms: attend 2 seminars each term for COMP students OR 1 seminar for COSC students

Details: http://www.cse.ust.hk/ug/comp4900
reviews.comment_teaching:
TEACHING
Just some topics related to CSE, sometimes is interesting while sometimes is...you know what I mean.
reviews.comment_grading:
GRADING
This subject only have 3 grades: P/PP/F (Pass/Permitted to Proceed/Fail)
You must not fail this subject in order to graduate
reviews.comment_workload:
Not heavy, just 2 seminars for each semester. After the seminar, submit at least 200 words within 1 week after the seminar.

Seminars are usually scheduled on Wed 6pm-7pm. Some occasional seminars will also count for COMP4900.
Arrive to the seminar venue before 6:10pm and take attendance with student card.

You can use ENGG1010 seminar to double count. Therefore, for year 2 and year 3 students, usually just need to attend to seminar each semester.
